intro: Iris cabulica, commonly known as the Persian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features sword-shaped, grass-like leaves and produces striking blue to violet flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
